title: Improve spec parsing and validation
description:
Fix specification parsing issues in scripts/bootstrap.py:

**Empty spec rejection (lines 304-307):**
- Check file size > 100 bytes minimum
- Check content has meaningful text (not just whitespace/headers)
- Reject with helpful message about what a spec should contain

**Requirements extraction (lines 141-148):**
- Support numbered lists: 1., 2., etc.
- Support paragraphs under Requirements heading
- Support markdown tables
- Support nested bullets
- Cap at 10 requirements (already documented)

**Project name extraction (lines 135-138):**
- Fallback to filename if no # Title found
- Handle specs without markdown headers
- Never return None for project_name

**Files to modify:**
- scripts/bootstrap.py

**Acceptance criteria:**
- Empty/minimal specs rejected with helpful message
- Requirements extracted from any common format
- Project name always has a sensible value
notes: Implemented: (1) Empty/minimal spec rejection with helpful messages (size<100 bytes, insufficient non-whitespace content, headers-only); (2) Requirements extraction from numbered lists (1. or 1)), nested bullets, markdown tables with ID/description parsing, and requirement-like paragraphs; (3) Project name fallback chain: markdown header → filename → 'New Project'. All changes in scripts/bootstrap.py.
